item.description:
In this talk, Ellery Schempp will address various aspects of SOCAS (the Separation Of Church And State), drawing on his experiences in the 1963 Supreme Court case, Abington vs. Schempp concerning Bible-reading and prayer in public schools. Over the course of his presentation, Schempp will contrast our secular Constitution with the Bible, give some history of religion's baneful influence, consider science, and explain why he is an Atheist and a member of a Unitarian-Universalist congregation.

The talk will last about 40 minutes, with Q & A to follow.

Map at http://www.wellesley.edu/CampusMaps/Buildings/pendleton.html.

Read more about Abington vs. Schempp at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abington_School_District_v._Schempp.

For more information, contact the event organizer, Katie Van Adzin of the student group Secular Wellesley, at kvanadzi@wellesley.edu.
item.name: Our Constitution and the Bible: a lecture by Ellery Schempp
